snippet: The magazine Popular Science has decided to shut off comments on its articles, saying ignorant, insulting and counterfactual posts were polluting the discourse and sowing confusion.
abstract: Magazine Popular Science has decided to shut off online reader comments on its articles, saying ignorant, insulting and counterfactual posts were polluting discourse and undermining public understanding and appreciation of science itself; move has prompted reactions, ranging from sympathetic to critical, from bloggers, editors and writers.
lead_paragraph: The magazine Popular Science has decided to shut off comments on its articles, saying ignorant, insulting and counterfactual posts were polluting the discourse and sowing confusion.
